definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)

sentences.english: We shall feel greatly obliged if you will remit us a cheque for the goods supplied you in December last.
sentences.chinese: 去年十二月送上貨物一批，請匯寄支票付款，甚謝。

sentences.english: How does a company remit its profits and dividends and repatriate capital abroad?
sentences.chinese: 該怎樣向國外匯寄其利潤與股息和從國外匯回資本？

sentences.english: You can send this money order by telegraphic transfer at the next window.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在下一個窗口用電匯寄這筆錢。

sentences.english: Can we remit our profit to foreign countries?
sentences.chinese: 我們能否將利潤匯寄到國外？

sentences.english: Remittance was made through a bank.
sentences.chinese: 款子是通過銀行匯寄的。

sentences.english: I hope you'll remit me the money in time.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你能及時把錢匯寄給我。

sentences.english: We shall be greatly obliged if you will remit us a check for the goods.
sentences.chinese: 若貴方匯寄支票付款，我方將十分感謝。
